Detailed Description

Defines a filterable listitem provider.

Filtering operations performed by calling filter(const gaia::base::String&) or filter(const gaia::base::String&, FilterListener*) are performed asynchronously. When these methods are called, a filtering request is posted in a request queue and processed later. Any call to one of these methods will cancel any previous non-executed filtering request.

See also:
IListItemProvider
IItemProvider

Member Function Documentation

virtual void gaia::ui::IFilterableListItemProvider::filter ( const gaia::base::String &  constraint) [pure virtual]

Starts an asynchronous filtering operation.

Calling this method cancels all previous non-executed filtering requests and posts a new filtering request that will be executed later.

Parameters:
constraintthe constraint used to filter the data
See also:
filter(const gaia:base::String&, FilterListener*)

Implemented in gaia::ui::CursorListItemProvider.

virtual void gaia::ui::IFilterableListItemProvider::filter ( const gaia::base::String &  constraint,
FilterListener *  listener 
) [pure virtual]

Starts an asynchronous filtering operation.

Calling this method cancels all previous non-executed filtering requests and posts a new filtering request that will be executed later. Upon completion, the listener is notified.

Parameters:
constraintthe constraint used to filter the data
listenera listener notified upon completion of the operation
